value: Design for Brooch with Woman in Broken Pedimet

label: Description
value: A woman is seated within a broken pediment, flanked by a pair of volutes and two upright faceted gems. Three pearls hanging below.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Provenance
value: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; 1901: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors

Study for an Alter Painting with Christ Child

label: Description

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors

label: Description
value: Recto: a monk or priest is shown turned toward the right, in profile. In the upper left corner, a study for a part of the head, and two more head studies beside, at right. Below are two studies for a left hand shown from the palm with thumb and forefinger touching each other.  Verso: twice, the right arm of a woman in profile, her hand holding drapery.  A study for the hand. Below, at left, a left hand holding a stem.

label: Physical description
value: Red and white chalk on blue paper

label: Provenance
value: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; 1901: acquired by the Museum
